headline: Tomato Cucumber Onion Salad
description: Tomato, cucumber, and onion in a simple red wine vinegar and olive oil dressing is a quick and easy salad.
name: Tomato Cucumber Onion Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Toss cucumber, tomato, olive oil, red wine vinegar, red onion, and white pepper together in a large bowl; season with salt. Refrigerate until slightly chilled, 10 to 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made this salad as a side dish. I loved it and so did my husband. Thank you for the recipe.
It was soupy. Next time I will add half the oil and vinegar. I am going to add 1/4 cup sugar as others have suggested.
Like others, I cut the vinegar and oil back to 1/2 and added a tsp. Of sugar. I added some sweet banana pepper we had around and yum! I think next time I’ll try it with rice vinegar instead.
I made this as a side dish for a BBQ. Everyone raved about it. I added some Italian seasoning and halved the oil and vinegar. Delicious! I would definitely make it again.
I cut the dressing by half and lit was great. Just be sure to coat. I think it would still be good too, with a little less oil in proportion. We enjoyed it
WAY too much oil and vinegar. 1/4 cup of oil and 1/8 cup of vinegar, and you have a winner.
Loved it! Quick and easy to make. Out of habit I added 1 tsp of sugar. Cut the vinegar.
Tomato Cucumber Onion Salad by Kissthecook. Too much dressing. Spring mix under, pumpernickel croutons on top perhaps.
I added chopped garlic, sliced black olives and a dollop of mayonnaise. Absolutely summery meal
Used with an heirloom tomato, pickling cucumber, and sweet white onion from my farm share. Made with half the dressing and it was perfect!
Fantastic. I took advice of others & cut the oil & vinegar n half as well as added 1tsp. if sugar. Tastes Amaaaaaazing. Thx for sharing
Super easy and basic and delicious. Exactly what I was looking for.
Couldn’t get past the overwhelming red wine vinegar. Added about 1/4 cup sugar and it helped. If I make it again, I’ll substitute balsamic for the red wine.

Really simple instructions to follow. I didn’t have red wine vinegar so I substituted balsamic. I also added Italian seasoning because I’m extra like that. My boyfriend who doesn’t care for tomatoes liked it as did my almost 14 yr old son who doesn’t care for vegetables in general.

This recipe is just okay. I put the 1 teaspoon of ground white pepper and I think that is way too much. It was also way too acidic! I added a teaspoon of sugar but I think I'm going to have to add more. I won't make this again.

This recipe is just okay. I put the 1 teaspoon of ground white pepper and I think that is way too much. It was also way too acidic! I added a teaspoon of sugar but I think I'm going to have to add more. I won't make this again.

Simple and absolutely yummy. I used hothouse cucumbers which already taste good by themselves, I planned on just dressing them with nothing else. it was yummy right away...but then I said to myself, you know what I'll add tomatoes that sounds so good. Then I said, you know what, let me add a white onion (didn't have red) that sounds so good. So I accidentally made the whole recipe and it was good each step of the way. Its tangy and balanced. I don't really enjoy raw tomatoes but I found myself fixing the perfect bite, 2 slices of cuke, one slice tomato and a slice of onion. After letting it sit for 15 minutes it was even better. I even offered some to my teenager that I don't even like talking to because it was so good I had to share. Thank you for this recipe!
Always an excellent salad!!
Refreshing and delicious!
Refreshing and delicious!

I expected this to be better. I had orange tomatoes from a friend which were not ideal too mushy. Next time I'll try Roma. And it doesn't last. But I like the dressing. So I will try again. By the way, I used the amounts I needed for the dressing, quarter cups instead of half. Still needs something to pep it up.
Made it for supper this evening. Doubled everything, but could have just done half the dressing. Super saucy! But tasty! Next time I make less dressing for sure.
Delicious. My mom used to make this and it was delicious but when I would make, it was inconsistent. Now that I have this recipe, I’ve used it many times and my family loves it.
I only had half a cucumber half a small onion and some cherry tomatoes. We will see how it tastes when hubby gets home! Super easy and very tasty.
Excellent! Added a little basil from the garden too. Fresh, crisp recipe
I read the reviews and used 1/4 cup oil and 1/4 red wine vinegar. It was a hit! So easy, so healthy, and so good!
One of my favorites for summer produce. Sometimes I add sweet peppers or other garden bounty.
I added red and orange peppers slices and used sweet onion! Very good
I agree with others, cut the vinegar and oil in half and add sugar. Fantastic
Great simple recipe! I usually leave everything the way it is but sometimes add crumbled feta.
this is a very good and fresh tasting salad excellent addition to any meal!
this is a very good and fresh tasting salad excellent addition to any meal!
Great salad. I like it with more zest. I added jicama and a little Tajín seasoning. Used less dressing. Sharing with my family for Easter brunch. I’m sure they will love it.

My two year old couldnt get enough much to my surprise. I did add about 3tsp of honey as a binder for the vinaigrette and only made half the vinaigrette mentioned in recipe. Everything was still swimming in it but it was vibrant and crisp and went well with a mexican dinner.
So easy and quick. Loved it, even as leftovers the next day!

This was amazing! I'm giving it 4 stars because I added some minor things.. A splash of balsamic rice wine vinegar, and also about a tablespoon of fresh cilantro. This is my new favorite (and healthy!) side dish/salad! *EDIT*: Be careful if you make this in advance and let it sit in the fridge overnight, the oil clumps up and goes to the top of the salad (which any kind of fat does).. Take it out of the fridge an hour or so before serving so the oil reincorporates itself with the rest of the salad.
Just one word! YUM!!!!!
Followed to the letter it was great took it to church supper.

Great Flavor! I didn't have white pepper, so I made it with regular black pepper and that was okay. It doesn't keep too long - I had to eat the leftovers within 2 days, so keep that in mind. I will definitely make that again.
Love this light, fresh and colorful salad. I used cherry tomatoes instead of regular and added in orange bell pepper and fresh basil too. Perfect for a hot, summer day!
Definitely will be using this recipe many more times. May add some mozzarella cheese to it also.
Great recipe... I added some fresh oregano from my herb garden!
Very tasty - I added a bit of Balsamic vinegar at the end because the olive oil was a touch much. Always better after you let it sit in the fridge for a couple of hours. I plan to make this again.
Add black olives and less oil and vinegar

The recipe was very tasty. I followed the instructions, and found that the amount of dressing produced was about twice as much as needed. Will make it again, but halve the ingredients for the dressing.

A neighbor gave me several cucumbers, another several tomatoes, and we had several Walla Walla Sweet onions so I needed a recipe... I was almost out of Red Wine Vinegar so I used Golden Balsamic. A little Olive Oil, per recipe, and I sprinkled a little Oregano, Dill, and fresh ground Pepper on it (no salt) OMG!! Best Cucumber salad ever!!!
My grandma made this recipe for years and loved it every holiday at her home. She used yellow onions and Italian bread for dipping....mmmm good!

This was excellent! Read the reviews, used 1/4c light olive oil and 3/4 c vinegar, 2 T sugar, salt, pepper and some Tuscan garlic spice. I made only one batch of dressing for 4 amounts of veggies. When the cookout was over I just added more veggies to the juice!
Just like Aunt Ruth's yum

Nice salad. We revamped the recipe after the first time making less dressing, used black pepper and added chopped bell pepper. We rate the revamped recipe 5 stars. Great for now with loads of tomatoes and cucumbers from the garden.
I'm making this salad every two weeks during the summer time. I can't get enough!
Too much vinegar. Also could use something starchy, tofu or beans maybe?

7 18 17 ... http://allrecipes.com/recipe/223397/tomato-cucumber-onion-salad/ ... Good & definitely easy! As SuzyQ said when recommending it, lessss dressssing - or a bigger salad. I wonder how wild it would be to have a spring mix in a bowl, cheese & top with this & some pumpernickel croutons. 'Sounds good to me! That extra dressing will marinate & be a dressing! I liked it. Thanks for posting!

I have a basil plant on my porch that is growing like crazy in the summer heat, so I added approx. 12 leaves, rinsed and chopped, to this recipe. Refrigerated longer, approx an hour and stirred a few times while in the fridge to blend the flavors. It is not necessary to refrigerate that long, I happen to like cold, crisp salads in the summer time. Delicious!
This is delish! I used English cucumber and grape tomoatoes because they are firmer, I cut back on the oil, and added fresh basil. I will make again soon!
This recipe is great! I've made it several times. The last time I used a red wine vinegar with garlic, and a sprinkle of Italian seasoning, yummy!!
Fresh, fast easy and great mix of taste and texture.
This is one of my favorite salads!
wonderful....added small amount of celery...more red onions...will continue to make...add oregano for interest and appeal as stated in review
It was really yummy!

8.24.2016-Quick and easy to make, but felt there was too much dressing. I would either reduce the olive oil and vinegar to 1/4 cup each or add an additional cucumber and tomato. Also, I thought the dressing could use some herbs in it, such as a little basil/oregano. Overall, the taste was good and I would make it again with some alterations. 10.9.2017-Made this again w/alterations in my original review and it was perfect for us! Steal Bookie's idea to toss it with some salad greens, which I'll be doing with the leftovers for lunch tomorrow.
I love cucumber salad. This was easy to make with simple ingredients. I used Vidalia onions and fresh cucumbers from the farm. I did add some parsley flakes and garlic salt to the salad.

I love this recipe. I make it every week during the summer. I halved the oil like suggested. I also wilted the ingredients in a colander with salt for 30 minutes. I then rinsed the salad and added the dressing. Delish!!
Gotta say, I didn't love the red wine vinegar in this. I've made it for years with reg vinegar and prefer that.
This was exactly what I was looking for!! My only modification was to sub black pepper for white pepper since I don't keep it in my pantry. Will make this again and again!
All the tastes of summer in a bowl! Made it with Tomato Pie 1 recipe, great combo

I added fresh basil, oregano, parsley and stevia leaves (instead of sugar) chopped fine in a food processor , am thinking about using the brine for fruit - blueberries, watermelon, peaches, serve it with a slotted spoon to leave behind the brine.
We really liked this simple recipe. Made exactly as written except used black pepper. Best when made fresh, gets a little tart after a day or two.
Excellent for summer garden vegetables use. Will make again.

This is my husband's favorite salad. I change nothing and it's
really delicious!

This is my husband's favorite salad. I change nothing and it's
really delicious!

After reading the reviews, I altered the recipe for more flavor and less liquid. It seemed just right to our taste. 
2 C tomatoes
2 C cucumber
1/2 C red onion
2 tsp white pepper - a bit less if you don't care for pepper
1 tsp salt
1/2 C red wine vinegar
1/4 EV Olive Oil

This is a great dish. I keep the tomatoes in wedges, the zucchini in round quarter inch slices, and onion in strips. Don't skimp on the sugar. Balance the vinegar and oil to the sugar. Omit pepper. Add a bunch of FRESH CHOPPED BASIL.

What a tasty and healthy salad that is easy to make. I divided it into two and cut the onion in half, just put it in mine. We started with cherries and ate the salad with BLATs! Great on the deck with ice tea or a glass of wine!

I am giving this 4 stars because it was soooo good, but I did make some changes after making a small test batch and tasting the dressing. Used half the amount of EVOO and less than half the vinegar (because it was a bit acidic), so basically halved the amount of liquid in the dressing and it was still plenty. Also halved the amount of red onion and reduced the amount of salt a bit. Added a generous heap of parsley flakes for color and flavor. Served it alongside barbecue at a big party I was hosting and it was a hit!
Delicious summer salad. I added green olives, it was actually a good touch.

My husband has tummy issues so when I came across this salad I was excited. I used an english cucumber, zucchini, green onion, a little fresh basil and like others, I added a little sugar. Really good on those hot summer days.
I will cut olive oil by 2/3 next time and add filtered water in place of it. Way too much olive oil...
Made it just like the recipe called for
Used half the liquids, thank you to reviewers. My husband said it was good too!

Very good, easy salad. My rating is based on tasting it before making changes. Afterwards, I added a bit of parsley just to enhance the presentation. This would also be a nice base recipe to build upon. Kudos to the original poster, and thanks for sharing it with us!
Absolutely delicious. I used a tad less olive oil and added a tsp sugar. Will make it again.

Excellent! Definitely use half the amount of liquid. My veggies were floating! I let the veggies marinate in the fridge for 15 minutes then I spooned out the excess liquid. I'll be making this again and again this summer!
I love this salad and so does my husband!!

Perfect! I didn't measure anything...used less olive oil than recipe called for, but then again I think I used less veggies...so that's to taste really. Wish I had home grown tomatoes, would've been even better, but I really loved this and it's super easy and uses ingredients I normally have. Oh and to SpikeRox...I did use white balsamic vinegar because that's what I had (and I love on everything) and it was great. Thank you for recipe!
I love this. It's the one I was looking for. Yum! I'm about to eat some now for lunch.
This was really good but I wish I had used white vinegar instead of red wine. That's just a personal preference based on how my mom used to make it.
I made this as directed and added 1/2 teas. of sugar and it was absolutely delicious. Love all the beautiful colors, you could add fresh basil if you have it, I am sure it would increase the taste.
Great using Vidalia or red onions. I l
Absolutely delicious!!! Perfect for a summer dinner!
So quick and easy! Excellent for a summer side dish! I added a little garlic powder and some parsley...so pretty.

Love the colors and taste of summer in this dish. Made this for a party so 4 tomatoes, 4 cukes, 3/4 red onion. Definitely need to deseed the veggies (loved the comment about using your fingers for the tomatoes #greatTip. Reduced to 1/4 c olive oil and red wine vinegar and added 1tsp of sugar. Also used black instead of white pepper because I was out.

I loved the flavors. The issue I had was WAY too much dressing. I tried it with 1/4 c vinegar and 1/4 c oil and it still was too much. The salt and pepper I left the same. I will still make it because it was really good, but I will add much more veggies and a dash of honey.

I made it for a crowd on Christmas and everyone loved it. Colorful and easier than having a conventional salad on the plate with other sides. I didn't read the reviews first and had way too much oil. Half is the answer.

I actually didn't try this particular recipe, but I make something similar very often. I cut up the cucumber, tomatoes and red onion, then add red wine vinegar dressing..I believe it's wishbone, then add salt and pepper...delicious every time! ALWAYS add salt...it makes the cucumbers absorb the dressing...makes a hug difference!

This reminds me of the summer salads my mom made when I was a kid. I love her dearly, but she isn't the greatest cook. They say it skips a generation. ANYWAY... Instead of chopping, I sliced the onions and cukes paper thin. I sliced the onion about an eighth of an inch thick. Like the other folks, I reduced the oil by half and added some sugar. Also, I mixed the dressing, onions and cukes together first and then added the tomatoes, so they wouldn't get all beat up. Delicious!
yes, a little sugar is nice. Cuts the vinegar a bit.
So easy, fresh and delish. Added a little splenda because I have a sweet tooth. Served with a steak dinner. Everyone loved it. Thank you for the recipe. It will be in our regular rotation.
Just a tad to vinegary for me but nice and easy, flavourful and color full.
